#Text=Add Massage Services to a Beauty Salon
#Text=Massage therapy provides health benefits by helping people relieve stress and by removing muscle tension .
#Text=If you 're looking to expand the offerings of your beauty salon , adding massage therapy treatments can help attract more clients and give your salon a competitive edge .
#Text=It may be difficult finding a massage therapist who fits with your clientele but adding a therapist to the team will prove profitable for your salon .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Setting a Workspace
#Text=Make a private space for massage clients .
#Text=Setting a room aside for your massage therapist and their clients allows for maximum comfort and privacy .
#Text=Make sure the room is large enough to house the necessary products , lay out a massage table , and allow your therapist to work comfortably .
#Text=The minimum size of the room should be by .
#Text=Sometimes , a massage therapist will provide their own lotions and massage oils , so talk with potential therapists to determine whether or not you need to purchase the supplies .
#Text=Purchase a massage table .
#Text=Massage tables can run anywhere $ 300 to a high-end $ 2000 model .
#Text=Many tables are offered through various professional websites .
#Text=Find a massage table that offers comfort and relaxation for your customers .
#Text=Sanitize the tables using disinfectant spray or wipes in between customers to stay hygienic .
#Text=Provide robes and towels .
#Text=Let your customers in robes and soft towels as they get ready for their massage .
#Text=Adding these personal touches will show that you care about your customers ' comfort levels .
#Text=Decent robes run around $ 17 each , but discounts are offered in ordered in bulk through specific sites .
#Text=Have enough robes and towels in stock to cover one day of business so each customer has a fresh robe .
#Text=Wash all the robes and towels used at the end of the day so they are clean for the next day .
#Text=Add calming ambient music .
#Text=In addition to helping block out noises from the rest of the salon , providing ambient music during a massage will help the customer relax and actually ease pain .
#Text=Keep the music at a lower volume for maximum relaxation .
#Text=Always have a backup method of providing music .
#Text=If the internet goes out , have CDs and a stereo to quickly replace the music .
#Text=Light candles for a relaxing environment .
#Text=Candlelight has a calming effect on many individuals .
#Text=Place a few around the room , at least from flammable substances and on sturdy surfaces .
#Text=Some customers may have sensitivity to scented candles , so it may be in your best interest to use unscented candles .
#Text=For a safe alternative , use flameless electric candles in place of standard candles .
#Text=Use essential oils to eliminate odor .
#Text=Essential oils come in a variety of scents and provide aromatherapy to customers .
#Text=The use of essential oils will also help mask any body odors that may be present in the room .
#Text=Provide a variety of scents , including but not limited to , eucalyptus , lavender , and tea tree .
#Text=Finding a Massage Therapist
#Text=Find a versatile massage therapist .
#Text=Your clients will differ in the style of massage they receive .
#Text=Many therapists will train in a variety of massage techniques .
#Text=Find a therapist that can cater to your clients ' various needs .
#Text=You can use the American Massage Therapy Association 's search engine to find trusted and professional therapists .
#Text=Offer Swedish massage to reduce stress .
#Text=When you think of massage , this is probably what you 're picturing .
#Text=Swedish massage is one of the most common and is used to help relax the body and relieve stress .
#Text=Using circular hand motions , a therapist will apply even pressure to the body .
#Text=Provide deep tissue massage to relieve muscle tension .
#Text=Consider this style similar to Swedish massage with more pressure applied .
#Text=Deep tissue massage will help work out troubled and strained areas on the body .
#Text=Choose between a contractor or full-time staff .
#Text=The average salary for a massage therapist as of 2014 is around $ 35,000 .
#Text=Many massage therapists are already independent contractors and will bring in an additional client base .
#Text=Having a contractor helps you not worry about providing benefits or deducting taxes , and you 'll be able to take portions of what you charge for the massage and profit it to the salon .
#Text=Contractors will be able to work anywhere unless a non-competition agreement is signed .
#Text=Ensure the therapist has the proper licensing for your location .
#Text=Many states will require a massage therapist to meet proper regulations and licensing .
#Text=This usually requires around 500 of schooling or curriculum .
#Text=This ensures the safety and well-being of your customers .
#Text=Check with your local regulations to determine what is necessary of your massage therapist .
#Text=Have liability and commercial property insurance .
#Text=Accidents happen .
#Text=Be sure that your salon has liability insurance to cover injuries that any of your clients may have .
#Text=Commercial property insurance will help cover any damage done to the property and the necessary materials your massage therapist will use .
#Text=Marketing Your New Services
#Text=Create handouts and takeaways for customers .
#Text=Flyers and business cards will help spread the addition of your new service .
#Text=Place them at the front counter in an easy to reach place so customers have easy access to them on their way in and out of the salon .
#Text=Find local businesses with public bulletin boards to hang announcements across your location .
#Text=Talk up new services to current customers .
#Text=Even when your customers are taking advantage of your other services , mention your new offering .
#Text=Planting the seed in their minds may help sway them into purchasing a massage service in the future .
#Text=Listen to your clients as they converse with the stylists .
#Text=If they mention being stressed , say “ You know , we 've just added a massage service that could help you . ”
#Text=Set a price for your massage services .
#Text=A good baseline price is set at $1/minute , but to make more profits , it 's okay to upcharge .
#Text=Many 60-minute massages start around $ 80 while 90-minute services cast around $ 100 .
#Text=Combine services to make a package deal .
#Text=Selling massages for full price and combining it with cheaper hair or nail service is a great way to ease your customers into a purchase .
#Text=Include these deals on your takeaways so customers can show prospective clients as well .
#Text=Have a survey or questionnaire for clients to fill out after the massage .
#Text=Ask questions like ' Did you enjoy your massage ? ' or ' Would you recommend our massage service to others ? '
#Text=This will help you gauge how your clients enjoy the new service that you provide .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Offer the lotions and oils used during a massage to the customer as at the front-end of the salon .
#Text=Things
#Text=You 'll Need
#Text=Massage table
#Text=Sheets and blankets
#Text=Oils , lotions and creams
#Text=Calming music
#Text=Cotton robes
